Articles.Content:
After seeing all the crying about people who can't handle change, I think we need a change of pace.

Personally, I am very much enjoying the new update, and any "problems" people seem to be mostly nit-picking on tiny details, and forgetting that *bugs happen* and the CTG wont necessarily play the same way you do.

WHY DID I START A POSITIVITY THREAD ALL NEGATIVE.

I am having a blast with this new update, and I expect any problems to be fixed soon enough.

Yep, it isn't easy adjusting to the new aerodynamics model and heating, but I seem to be adapting! Planes are now a lot more fun to fly, and everything feels a lot more real.

I haven't progressed in career enough to do the mining and scanning yet, but I am looking forward to putting that to use.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T22:20:28Z" title="04/27/2015 10:20  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by gompasta**

Overall I'm loving 1.0. Best update yet IMO.

Only just scratched the surface of what's new as well. Rebuilding my lifter family so they work in this version. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Yes there are problems but they are vastly outweighed by the good things.

well there's a difference between nit picking and your crafts flipping head first into the atmo and exploding with no way of saving them

i love this update but come on squad that's why we said we wanted a 0.95 also reports are coming that the SPH is a buggy mess

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T22:07:55Z" title="04/27/2015 10:07  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by EladDv**
I am having fun as well as with all new updates.
I'm having a lot of fun, it really requires rethinking your old strategies. Got a mildly bothering bug, but otherwise I didn't expect the world and am happy about 1.0.
My first plane hit 1100m/s at sea level and then exploded in spectacular fashion, good times. ![-_-](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_sleep.png)
The plane controls are just perfect. Much better than before. But the issue with the capsule going backwards is really sad.

> 
> The plane controls are just perfect. Much better than before. But the issue with the capsule going backwards is really sad.

Easily solved by putting a little finlet on the top of your capsule to raise the CoL. New world requires new thinking. Solve the problems yourself, instead of asking "God" to change the universe.

I just wrapped up my first 1.0 session, and even after stranding my crew on Minmus I'm loving the update! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) There's so much new stuff, I just don't know how to use it all!

The instability is indeed a bit weird, but not a huge problem: A slight amount of control or opening a chute as high as possible solved every instability for me.

Seems like the usual rule goes: Want a bug free/fixed release? Wait for the first patch.^^'

Well, it seems functional for the most part.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T22:14:41Z" title="04/27/2015 10:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by Temeter**

Way to start off a "Positivity Thread" by bagging on everyone that is reporting all the bugs, glitches, and just plain wrong stuff with this release.

On a positive note, I'm enjoying being a volunteer QA testor for Squad after the release. It genuinely is fun to find all the reasons why this never should have been called 1.0

Well I just flew the big MK3 stock plane (106 parts) to its ceiling with a green clock, which is an improvement!

Then it blew up cos it's got too much thrust now ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif) Performance good, but the default craft might need a wee smidge of tuning methinks ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
I love the aero, perfect balance between realism and ease of use!

One thing to note is that planes are incredibly fun to fly! They also look good. I researched only a single plane node and the resulting craft actually looks like a plane. Distinctivly kerbal, but definitly a plane. That's new.

First SSTO spaceplane made, first attempt nearly made orbit = happy.

First Munar mission (Apollo-style), first attempt, landed on Mun and returned to Kerbin = happy.

So far, very very pleased ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
